endpoints.order

Class Orders

  • java.lang.Object
    • endpoints.order.Orders

  • public class Orders
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to to communicate between the front end and back end in regards to orders.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrderItems

        public static java.lang.String getOrderItems(spark.Request request,
                                             spark.Response response)
        Returns an order as JSON. JSON input: foodOrderId: The ID for the food order being listed.
        Parameters:
        request - A HTTP request object.
        response - A HTTP response object.
        Returns:
        A string containing JSON which holds the current order.

      • getOrdersByTable

        public static java.lang.String getOrdersByTable(spark.Request request,
                                                spark.Response response)
        Returns a list of orders for a table in JSON. JSON input: tableNumber
        Parameters:
        request - A HTTP request object.
        response - A HTTP response object.
        Returns:
        A string containing the JSON for the orders on a table.

      • getOrdersByStatus

        public static java.lang.String getOrdersByStatus(spark.Request request,
                                                 spark.Response response)
        Returns a list of orders for a particular status ie. Cooking in JSON. JSON input: orderStatus.
        Parameters:
        request - A HTTP request object.
        response - A HTTP response object.
        Returns:
        A String containing the JSON for the orders that have a status.

      • addOrderMenuItem

        public static java.lang.String addOrderMenuItem(spark.Request request,
                                                spark.Response response)
        Adds an orderMenuItem to an order. JSON input: foodOrderId, menuItemId requirements: A string representing a description/extra details for the order.
        Parameters:
        request - A HTTP request object.
        response - A HTTP response object.
        Returns:
        A JSON string representing the MenuItem, or "failure"

      • changeOrderStatus

        public static java.lang.String changeOrderStatus(spark.Request request,
                                                 spark.Response response)
        Changes the order status JSON input: foodOrderId, newOrderStatus: A string representing the new order status. This can be CANCELLED, ORDERING, READY_TO_CONFIRM, COOKING, READY_TO_DELIVER or DELIVERED.
        Parameters:
        request - A HTTP request object.
        response - A HTTP response object.
        Returns:
        A string saying either "success" or "failed"

      • removeOrderMenuItem

        public static java.lang.String removeOrderMenuItem(spark.Request request,
                                                   spark.Response response)
        Removes an item from an order JSON input: orderMenuItemId
        Parameters:
        request - A HTTP request object.
        response - A HTTP response object.
        Returns:
        A string saying either "success" or "failed"

      • getOrderId

        public static java.lang.String getOrderId(spark.Request request,
                                          spark.Response response)
        This method gets the current foodOrderId for the table. If one doesn't exist it creates it.
        Parameters:
        request - A HTML request.
        response - A HTML response.
        Returns:
        A foodOrderId in the form of a string.

      • changeOrderInstructions

        public static java.lang.String changeOrderInstructions(spark.Request request,
                                                       spark.Response response)
        Updates the instructions for a given OrderMenuItem. JSON input: orderMenuItemId, instructions
        Parameters:
        request - The HTTP request object.
        response - The HTTP response object.
        Returns:
        A string saying 'success' or 'failure'

      • getAllOrdersForTable

        public static java.lang.String getAllOrdersForTable(spark.Request request,
                                                    spark.Response response)
        Returns a string representing a JSON array of all the orders, their status and their contents
        Parameters:
        request - The HTTP request
        response - The HTTP response
        Returns:
        A string formatted to represent JSON.
